result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan James Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Under supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge.
Pay balance of Court  costs, fees, surcharges and DNA surcharge.  To be paid over  period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No contact with the McDonald's located at 6000 S. 108 Street, Hales Corners, WI.
Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan James Wagner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet
5/6/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form; filed.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; filed.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time. 
Credit given for 1 day time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 6 MONTHS under the supervision of Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* No contact with the McDonald's located at 6000 South 108th Street, Hales Corners, WI.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State moves to revoke the DPA agreement based upon defendant's new criminal charge in Waukesha County.
Statements made.
Court GRANTS motion and "REVOKED" the DPA agreement approved by the Court on 10-01-2015.

**Court ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PER THE PERMISSION OF JUDGE DONALD, CLERK ADJOURNED TODAY'S REVIEW HEARING OFF THE RECORD.

Parties need more time to discuss DPA extension and revocation.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 04-22-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned DPA Review Hearing.
Final Review with attachments filed by ADA Jesica Ballenger on behalf of the State.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for 90-day DPA Review Hearing.
Defendant is doing well with DPA requirements.
Statements made.

Case adjourned to 04-11-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for 2nd 90-Day DPA Review Hearing.
Defendant's Letter of Apology; filed.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case adjourned to 01-11-2016 at 8:30 AM for a 90-Day DPA Review Hearing before Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
FILED, Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties still under negotiations and request a  DPA Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 10-01-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing/DPA.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery.  State has not obtained the disc of the defendant's statement as of today.  Case reset for pretrial.

Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 07/23/2015

15RM034706  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-23-2015
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with McDonalds at 6000 S 108th St, Hales Corners, WI and all its employees.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nathan James Wagner in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 44.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-24-2015 at 01:30pm
